poem:
### Sellafield Awakens

In the shadow of plutonium  
and bureaucratic whispers,  
£2.8 billion feels as light  
as wind over the Irish Sea.  
Silent alarms flutter—  
cuts draw near like distant waves,  
leaving the future of atoms  
and livelihoods to tremble,  
beneath the weight of penny-vigilant eyes.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Sellafield nuclear site plans cuts as chief says £2.8bn funding ‘not enough’ Sellafield has said nearly £3bn in new funding is “not enough” and bosses are now examining swingeing cuts, prompting fears over jobs and safety at the vast nuclear waste dump. The Cumbrian nuclear site, which is home to the world’s largest store of plutonium, was last week awarded £2.8bn for the next financial year, the bulk of the total of just over £4bn". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
